data.title: University & College Admissions
data.metaDescription: Our highly qualified and certified Immigration and Education Consultants specialising in key destinations match your profile and preferences to your right-fit universities

sectionHero.title: University & College Admissions
sectionHero.shortDescription: Embark on your educational journey in Australia with our dedicated support. If you're eager to explore study and visa options, we're here to help you navigate every step of the way.
sectionHero.secondTitle: Discover the Right Study Abroad Opportunity for You
sectionHero.description: We believe that every student has the right to access a global education. However, discovering the best fit can be an overwhelming task, considering all the information out there. Our expert education consultants simplify this task to a far more stress-free and intuitive process. We work one-to-one with students to thoroughly understand their academic profiles and preferences, personalising program and university recommendations that best suit your needs. With this shortlist, students can confidently begin applications knowing they have found their perfect university fit.
sectionHero.alt: Course and University Guidance for International Students

SectionCounsellingAndSupport.title: Course Selection and Application
SectionCounsellingAndSupport.shortDescription: Australia houses world-renowned universities and colleges, offering a plethora of study options. Choosing where and what to study can be a challenge, but as experts in international student placements, our consultants are ready to assist. We'll help you select a course that aligns with your aspirations and maximize your chances of acceptance.

nativeService.title: Course and University Guidance for International Students
services: Interests, timeline, budget, and career goals
Upcoming information events relevant to you

SectionHowItWorks.shortDescription: When you connect with our agents, we'll engage in a comprehensive discussion covering:

process.title: Submitting Your Study Applications
process.shortDescription: We take care of the entire application process on your behalf. From providing necessary documents to certifying supporting materials, we ensure a seamless submission to your chosen university or institution. Attend education seminars to discuss course structures and graduate outcomes.

process.title: Response from the Study Provider
process.shortDescription: Expect a response within 2-6 weeks of application submission. If accepted, you'll receive an offer letter. In some cases, eligibility assessments and offer letters can be obtained during interviews at our office or international student events.

process.title: Acceptance and Payment
process.shortDescription: Upon receiving an offer letter without conditions, you can accept immediately. Conditions may include new language test results or academic transcripts. Your counselor will guide you through the deposit payment process directly to the university, making it a straightforward experience.

services.title: Student Loan & Scholarship
services.shortDescription: With thorough guidance in seeking funding and finance opportunities, from student loans to scholarships, we make study abroad opportunities more accessible.

services.title: Application Process
services.shortDescription: Access step-by-step support in building complete application packages with the strongest shot of admissions success with our specialists.

services.title: Accommodation Booking
services.shortDescription: Find your home away from home through Study Internationalâ€™s international accommodation provider partners.

SectionCounsellingAndSupport.title: Student Counselling: Your Gateway to a Successful Study Abroad Journey
SectionCounsellingAndSupport.shortDescription: Are you looking for the best education opportunities in Australia? Do you need professional and reliable guidance to help you achieve your academic goals? If yes, then you have come to the right place. At Moves International, we offer comprehensive student counselling services to help you find the right course and institution for your education.

process.title: Course selection
process.shortDescription: We can help you explore and compare different courses and programs offered by various universities and colleges in Australia, and help you choose the one that matches your interests, abilities, and aspirations.

process.title: Admission requirements
process.shortDescription: We can help you understand and meet the admission requirements for your chosen course and institution, such as academic qualifications, English language proficiency, and other criteria.

process.title: Application process
process.shortDescription: We can help you prepare and submit your application documents, such as transcripts, certificates, personal statements, and references, and ensure that they are complete and accurate.

process.title: Enrolment procedures
process.shortDescription: We can help you confirm your enrolment and accept your offer letter from your institution, and guide you through the steps to secure your place and start your course.

process.title: Study plan
process.shortDescription: We can help you plan and manage your study schedule, workload, and assignments, and provide you with tips and strategies to improve your academic skills and performance.

process.title: Career guidance
process.shortDescription: We can help you explore and pursue your career options and opportunities after completing your course, and provide you with advice on resume writing, job search, and interview preparation.

services.shortDescription: With thorough guidance in seeking funding and finance opportunities, from student loans to scholarships, we make study abroad opportunities more accessible.

sectionHero.title: Health Insurance OSHC/OVHC
sectionHero.shortDescription: Planning to study, work, or travel in Australia? Understanding Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) and Overseas Visitors Health Cover (OVHC) is crucial for your well-being and visa compliance.

SectionCounsellingAndSupport.title: Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) & Overseas Visitors Health Cover (OVHC)
SectionCounsellingAndSupport.shortDescription: Embarking on a journey to Australia for study, travel, or work necessitates securing OSHC and OVHC, an essential aspect of your comprehensive planning. As an international student in Australia, overlooking overseas student health coverage is not an option. Moves International is here to facilitate your connection with leading insurance providers, ensuring your well-being with a robust health insurance policy.

process.title: What is OSHC or Overseas Student Health Coverage?
process.shortDescription: OSHC is a mandatory requirement for student visas in Australia. Whether you are continuing your studies or arriving as a visitor or tourist, OSHC, also known as overseas visitors' health cover (OVHC), is imperative for your stay.

process.title: What is OVHC or Overseas Student Health Coverage?
process.shortDescription: For those visiting Australia for travel purposes, OVHC is a prerequisite. It emphasizes the need for appropriate health insurance before entering Australia, ensuring your safety and granting access to medical services throughout your stay. Partner with us to secure OVHC from premier health insurance agencies.

process.title: Moves International: Your Partner in Health Coverage
process.shortDescription: Moves International connects you with leading insurance providers, ensuring you secure the best OSHC or OVHC plan for your needs. Contact us today to start your journey towards comprehensive health coverage in Australia.

sectionHero.title: PROFESSIONAL YEAR Program in Australia
sectionHero.shortDescription: If you're a recent international graduate in Australia studying Accounting, IT, or Engineering, gaining a Professional Year certificate can significantly enhance your chances of securing Permanent Residency (PR).

detailInfo.title: Unlock Your Potential and Achieve Your Career Aspirations through the Professional Year Program
detailInfo.description:
Tailored for graduates in Engineering, IT, and Accounting, the Professional Year Program is designed to empower you with essential skills for excellence in your chosen field, paving the way for your future professional endeavors.

For international students aspiring to enter the Australian job market, the Professional Year Program stands out as an optimal choice, especially in key cities such as Melbourne, Perth, Sydney, Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Darwin, and Hobart.

Completion of the Professional Year Program not only provides a competitive edge for Engineering, IT, and Accounting graduates but also contributes five valuable points towards their Australian Permanent Residency application. The program spans 44 weeks, incorporating a 12-week internship period that facilitates a seamless transition into the workplace environment.

If you are a graduate in Engineering, IT, or Accounting aiming to enhance your skill set and elevate your prospects for suitable employment, enrolling in the Professional Year Program is a strategic move. It ensures you acquire indispensable skills and hands-on experience, positioning you for success in your future career endeavors.

sectionEligibility.title: Basic Requirements for Professional Year Program Eligibility:
sectionEligibility.shortDesc: To be eligible for enrollment in a Professional Year Program, candidates must meet specific criteria:

eligibility.title: Educational Qualifications
eligibility.desc: Prospective candidates should hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in the disciplines of Accounting, IT, or Engineering.

eligibility.title: Language Proficiency
eligibility.desc: Applicants are required to demonstrate language proficiency, with a minimum overall score of 6 bands in IELTS or a score of 50 overall in PTE to qualify for the Post Study Work Stream 485.

eligibility.title: Accounting Professional Year Program Specifics
eligibility.desc: For those pursuing the Accounting Professional Year Program, additional criteria apply. Applicants must achieve a score of six bands in each module of the IELTS exam for the Temporary Graduate Visa Subclass 485. Furthermore, candidates should have more than 12 months remaining on their 485 visa to be eligible for registration in a Professional Year Program.

keyAdvantage.title: Key Advantages of the Professional Year Program

advantage.title: Australian Permanent Residency Points
advantage.desc: Â A pivotal benefit of completing the Professional Year Program is the acquisition of five valuable points towards the Australian Permanent Residency (PR) application, enhancing your prospects for long-term residency.

advantage.title: Cultural Insight
advantage.desc: The program offers a unique opportunity to gain a comprehensive understanding of Australian culture, fostering cultural adaptability and enriching your global perspective.

advantage.title: Enhanced CV Value
advantage.desc: Participation in the Professional Year Program significantly elevates the value of your Curriculum Vitae (CV), showcasing your commitment to professional development and your proactive approach to career advancement.

advantage.title: Professional Skill Development
advantage.desc: The internship component of the program plays a crucial role in building and refining your professional skills. Practical experience in a real-world work environment ensures you are well-equipped for the challenges of your chosen industry.

advantage.title: Professional Year Certificate
advantage.desc: Successful completion of the internship program culminates in the attainment of a Professional Year certificate, a tangible recognition of your dedication and achievement during the program.

advantage.title: Networking Opportunities
advantage.desc: Engaging in the internship aspect allows you to establish connections with industry professionals. This networking opportunity can be instrumental in creating valuable contacts and opening doors to potential career advancements.

faq.question: What is the Professional Year (PY) Program?
faq.answer: The Professional Year (PY) Program is a 44-week program that provides international graduates with the opportunity to gain practical work experience and develop the skills they need to succeed in the Australian workplace. The program is designed to bridge the gap between full-time study and employment in Australia.

faq.question: Who is eligible for the PY Program?
faq.answer:
To be eligible for the PY Program, you must have graduated from an Australian university with a qualification in one of the following fields:

  • Accounting
  • Engineering
  • Information technology

You must also meet the following requirements:

  • Have a valid student visa
  • Have a good command of English
  • Have a strong academic record

faq.question: How can I apply for the PY Program?
faq.answer:
To apply for the PY Program, you must contact a registered PY provider. There are a number of registered PY providers located throughout Australia.

The application process will vary depending on the provider, but it will typically involve submitting the following documents:
  • Completed application form
  • Copy of your passport
  • Copy of your student visa
  • Copy of your academic transcript
  • Copy of your English language proficiency test results

faq.question: How much does the PY Program cost?
faq.answer: The cost of the PY Program varies depending on the provider and the field of study. However, you can expect to pay between $15,000 and $25,000 for the program.

faq.question: Are there any scholarships or funding options available to help me pay for the PY Program?
faq.answer:
Registered PY providers offer a range of support services to their students, including:

  • Scholarships
  • Grants
  • Loans

faq.question: What are the benefits of completing the PY Program?
faq.answer:
There are many benefits to completing the PY Program, including:

  • Gaining practical work experience
  • Developing essential workplace skills
  • Enhancing your employability
  • Earning valuable migration points

faq.question: What is the internship placement component of the PY Program?
faq.answer: The internship placement is a 12-week component of the PY Program that allows graduates to apply their skills and knowledge in a real-world setting. The internship placement is typically in an area related to the graduate's field of study.

faq.question: What kind of support is available to me during the PY Program?
faq.answer:
Registered PY providers offer a range of support services to their students, including:

  • Academic support
  • Career guidance
  • Visa and immigration advice
  • Personal support

faq.question: What are the job prospects for PY Program graduates?
faq.answer: PY Program graduates have a high rate of employment success. In fact, a recent study found that 80% of PY Program graduates were employed within six months of completing the program.

faq.question: What is the migration pathway for PY Program graduates?
faq.answer: PY Program graduates can earn five points towards their Australian permanent residency application. These points can be valuable for graduates who are looking to stay in Australia after completing their studies.

faq.question: Where can I find more information about the PY Program?
faq.answer: For more information about the PY Program, you can visit the website of the Australian Department of Home Affairs.

faq.question: Are there any additional things I should consider before applying for the PY Program?
faq.answer:
Before applying for the PY Program, you should make sure that:

  • You are interested in gaining practical work experience in Australia
  • You want to develop the skills you need to succeed in the Australian workplace
  • You are committed to completing the 44-week program
  • You are able to afford the cost of the program

faq.question: What is the typical schedule for a PY Program student?
faq.answer:
The typical schedule for a PY Program student will vary depending on the provider and the field of study. However, a typical schedule will include:

  • Classroom training
  • Internship placement
  • Work on assignments

faq.question: What are the assessment methods used in the PY Program?
faq.answer:
The assessment methods used in the PY Program will vary depending on the provider and the field of study. However, assessment methods may include:

  • Essays
  • Reports
  • Presentations
  • Exams

faq.question: What can I do to increase my chances of getting into the PY Program?
faq.answer:
To increase your chances of getting into the PY Program, you should:

  • Apply early
  • Have a strong academic record
  • Have a good command of English
  • Have relevant work experience

sectionHero.shortDescription: Begin your journey towards a brighter future by leveraging your knowledge and skills to obtain an RPL qualification today. Get started now with a complimentary skills assessment!

rplCertificate.title: Free Skills Assessment
rplCertificate.desc: Speak to Moves International about your goals, and allow us to guide you towards the qualification that will help you reach them.

rplCertificate.title: Portfolio of Experience
rplCertificate.desc: Your dedicated consultant will guide you through the process of putting together a portfolio of evidence. This can contain overseas qualifications, transcripts, certificates, photos and videos, samples or work examples, letters of reference, your current resume, etc.

rplCertificate.title: Evidence Review
rplCertificate.desc: Once one of our partner registered training organisations (RTOs) has assessed your portfolio, the assessor assigned to your case may be in touch if any additional evidence is required. If you have any weak areas, the RTO may assign a trainer to upskill you at no cost to you.

rplCertificate.title: Youâ€™re qualified
rplCertificate.desc: Moves International is partnered with Registered Training Organisations whose qualifications are nationally recognised in Australia, and are the same as the qualification you would receive from full time study. Qualifications can also be useful for licensing or immigration purposes.

sectionProcess.title: The RPL Process
sectionProcess.shortDesc: The RPL (Recognition of Prior Learning) process typically involves the following steps:

process.title: Free Skills Assessment
process.desc: You start by taking a free 60-second skills assessment to determine your eligibility for an RPL qualification.

process.title: Evidence Submission
process.desc: Youâ€™ll need to submit evidence of your work experience, such as a resume, reference letters, work examples, photos, and any overseas qualifications.

process.title: Competency Conversation
process.desc: A licensed trade assessor will conduct a competency conversation with you to discuss your skills and experience.

process.title: Practical Observation
process.desc: If required, a practical observation will be conducted to assess your competencies in a real-world setting.

process.title: Review Process
process.desc: Your portfolio of evidence will be reviewed by a licensed trade assessor to ensure it meets the required standards.

process.title: Qualification Issuance
process.desc: Once the review process is completed, youâ€™ll receive a nationally recognised qualification issued by a Qualify Me! partner college.

process.title: Further Assistance
process.desc: If needed, youâ€™ll receive assistance with license applications or starting up a business.

keyAdvantage.title: How employers use RPL to benefit
keyAdvantage.shortDesc: The benefits of Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) are significant, especially for individuals with extensive work experience but without formal qualifications. Here are some key advantages:

advantage.title: Career Advancement
advantage.desc: Â RPL can lead to a formal qualification that may be required for certain job roles, promotions, or industry licenses, thus opening up new career opportunities.

advantage.title: Time and Cost Efficiency
advantage.desc: Since RPL assesses your existing skills and knowledge, it can reduce or eliminate the need for additional study, saving you both time and money.

advantage.title: Validation of Skills
advantage.desc: It provides official recognition of your skills and experience, validating your capabilities to employers and industry bodies.

advantage.title: Personal Development
advantage.desc: Achieving a qualification through RPL can boost your confidence and motivation by acknowledging your hard work and expertise.

advantage.title: Flexibility
advantage.desc: The RPL process is designed to be flexible, allowing you to continue working while you complete your qualification.

advantage.title: Business Opportunities
advantage.desc: With the right qualification, you might be able to start your own business or take on higher-level responsibilities within your current role.

whoUse.title: Who uses RPL?
whoUse.shortDesc: Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) is utilized by a diverse group of individuals, including:

useCradData.title: Working Professionals
useCradData.desc: Those who have gained significant industry experience and wish to have their skills formally recognized to advance their careers.

useCradData.title: Skilled Tradespeople
useCradData.desc: Individuals in trades who have learned their skills on the job and seek formal qualifications to obtain a trade license or certification.

useCradData.title: Overseas Workers
useCradData.desc: People who have gained relevant skills and experience outside of Australia and want to have their competencies recognized within the Australian system.

useCradData.title: Career Changers
useCradData.desc: Those looking to transition into a new field and want to leverage their existing skills and experience for a qualification in their new chosen profession.

useCradData.title: Lifelong Learners
useCradData.desc: Individuals who have engaged in continuous learning through various non-formal or informal means and wish to have this learning acknowledged in a formal qualification.

rplIndustries.title: RPL Industries
rplIndustries.shortDesc: Pioneering Excellence in Moves International Innovating Tomorrow's Solutions, Today, for a Sustainable and Dynamic Future.

faq.question: What is Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL)?
faq.answer: RPL is an assessment process that evaluates your skills, knowledge, and experience against the criteria of a formal qualification.

faq.question: How does the RPL process work?
faq.answer: The process includes a free skills assessment, evidence submission, competency conversation, practical observation, and a review process leading to a nationally recognised qualification.

faq.question: What kind of evidence do I need to provide?
faq.answer: Youâ€™ll need to submit a portfolio that includes a resume, reference letters, work examples, photos, and any relevant certificates or qualifications.

faq.question: How long does the RPL process take?
faq.answer: The duration varies depending on the individualâ€™s experience and the evidence provided but is generally faster than traditional study methods.

faq.question: Is the RPL qualification recognised nationally?
faq.answer: Yes, the qualifications obtained through RPL are nationally recognised and issued by Qualify Me! partner colleges.

faq.question: Can RPL help me get a trade license?
faq.answer: Absolutely, RPL can provide the qualifications necessary to apply for various trade licenses and certifications.

faq.question: What if I donâ€™t have enough experience for a full qualification?
faq.answer: Absolutely, RPL can provide the qualifications necessary to apply for various trade licenses and certifications.

faq.question: Are there any payment plans available for RPL?
faq.answer: Moves International! offers flexible payment options, discounts, and a best price guarantee to make the RPL process affordable.

faq.question: What are the benefits of obtaining an RPL qualification?
faq.answer: RPL qualifications can lead to career advancement, time and cost savings, validation of skills, personal development, and new business opportunities.
